newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK stocks slightly higher but lack direction.
newsitem.headline: HK stocks slightly higher but lack direction.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks were slightly higher on Friday morning but players were staying on the sidelines due to a lack of direction, brokers said.
The Hang Seng Index edged up 92 points, or 0.65 percent, to 14,304 after opening softer. Turnover was HK$3.16 billion.
"The market is lacking in direction with two-way interest seen on blue chips and I don't see too much excitement for today," said Sean Li, associate director at Amsteel Securities.
Shares of Chu Kong Shipping 0560.HK surged to HK$3.275 in their trading debut, up from the issue price of HK$1.20.
